fields.summary: persistent jobs in global scheduler

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) Load the attached svn dump
2) Next point your fisheye to your svn repository where you loaded the dump
3) After the index, go to browse your fisheye repository and on the left add the author constraint "host\est.user"

You will get a 404 error
fields.summary: Author constraints with usernames that have "\" fail

fields.description:
Annotation information for individual files could be stored in the infdb cache for all files or a subset of files to reduce the calculation needed get annotation or blame.

One strategy would be to cache the annotation after a set number of modifications, so there's a maximum number of steps required to generate the annotation for any file.
fields.summary: investigate adding annotation info for files to infdb cache

fields.description: Diff text indexing currently creates thousands of text files that are stored for the length of the slurp --- these could be indexed in lucene much earlier
fields.summary: fix diff text caching
continuing work on the fisheye api
follow up qnav reviews from M1

fields.description: address feedback from https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-911
fields.summary: exception handling in fisheye api needs rework

fields.description:
This scenario came up after I rsynced a remote folder, but I forgot a trailing / and got another folder.  fixing this minor problem I went on to other things, not checking.

After the rysnc took, the updated root directory perms were rwxrwx--- for which the FE process user could not access at all.

I thought this was initially related a repository scan problem but no, I restarted FE with different memory paramters, with/without the troublesome repo entry and the result was the same.  EOM:
{noformat}
ERROR: problem running command
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:105)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:38)
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Arrays.java:2882)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.expandCapacity(AbstractStringBuilder.java:100)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:572)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:203)
	at java.io.UnixFileSystem.resolve(UnixFileSystem.java:93)
	at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:207)
	at java.io.File.listFiles(File.java:1056)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.io.IOHelper.recursiveDeleteImpl(IOHelper.java:158)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.io.IOHelper.recursiveDelete(IOHelper.java:143)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DiffTextCache.<init>(DiffTextCache.java:51)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.<init>(RepositoryScanner.java:66)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.P4Scanner.<init>(P4Scanner.java:48)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.P4RepositoryEngine.<init>(P4RepositoryEngine.java:36)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.P4RepositoryConfig.createRepositoryEngine(P4RepositoryConfig.java:140)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.run(RepositoryHandle.java:265)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RepositoryManager.runRepository(RepositoryManager.java:222)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.startRepositories(RootConfig.java:349)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:261)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:44)
	... 6 more
{noformat}

I'm guessing that there is something not quite kosher in the exception handling for native command execution/cleanup....
fields.summary: non-read/execute perms on a repo cause FE to loop until EOM (512M/6G even) in a short time

fields.description: When single sign on is used the users are logined with "DOMAIN\user1" and, thus, FishEye is expected to provide such a possibility. When auto add-on is switched on the users with domains are added to the system properly but this auto add-on should be switched off in our case. It seems that this kind of validation(disallow slashes in the userName) is not principal, thus it would be useful if you provide the ability to use slashes in the usernames. Thanks.
fields.summary: Add user: add the ability to use slashes in userName to allow to create users with domains like "DOMAIN\user1"

fields.description: When administrator tries to add a new user in the administration console and selects 'built-in' auth type passwords are not required and the visibility of password input fields should be set to false. Indeed, this is done by the javascript but it douesn't work. The error seems to occur because of the id mismatch: "password1" and "passwordfield1" in the corresponding javascript.
fields.summary: Add user: when built-in auth type is selected passwords are not hidden.

fields.description: inner tag should be fileRevision not fileRevisions?
fields.summary: FE rest api should return <fileRevision> inside <fileRevisions>

fields.description:
*Desired* the /api/rest/login method, and the /rest-service/auth-v1/login method should generate tokens that can be used anywhere in the instance.

*Previously* /api/rest/login tokens could only be used under /api/, and /rest-service/auth-v1/login could only be used under /rest-service/. And neither could be used anywhere else on the instance (including, annoyingly, csv-eyeql calls, json-LOC-data calls, etc).
fields.summary: REST auth-tokens should be instance-wide

fields.description: as title.  Yes it can be done (has been done) by hand, but should be done by default, this becomes needed when one investigates the error log for activity and other than the logfile time stamp, has no idea as to timings of logged events.
fields.summary: Default logging should include a timestamp of the event, currently only the criticality and text is logged

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot. I expect to see the trunk commits to be displayed under the branch commits as they are older than the branch commits.

What is currently displayed is confusing and often leads me to missing important commit information when browsing the history for files with a high volume of commits.
fields.summary: Display commits for a branched file before the trunk commits that were performed prior to the branch operation

fields.description: The display of the Line History graph should respect my user setting (as it does correctly on the browse page for a directory).
fields.summary: The "Show linecount history graph" user setting is not respected on the browse page for a file

fields.description:
Currently the 5mb limit that we place on indexing content is hardcoded. 

We should make this configurable. (As per customer request at [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1407])

However I still think we need to set some sort of sensible upper limit, for example should we allow users to specify 100mb? Can the browser even render a file that large? 
We should keep the default at 5mb, and place a warning in the administration about the consequences of raising this value.
fields.summary: Make the 5mb limit on indexing content configurable
enable ant globs and camel case search for quicknav

fields.description: Move the util classes in src/tests-cru/com/cenqua/crucible/spi/** to a fisheye package, so they can be used by the new FE rest tests, whithout being duplicated.
fields.summary: Move Common REST Test Utils to FishEye Package

fields.description: Our auth cookies (infact all cookies) should have httpOnly set on them. This reduces the exposure to cookie-stealing via injected JS.
fields.summary: Cookies with sensitive information should be HttpOnly
create admin options page for quick nav

fields.description:
work out where these little images should actually go

When you look at the page there are these micro-graphs and it's not obvious that they are links-to-alternate-versions. They should somehow be associated with the radioboxes that they represent on the LHS. Either with an identical label, or they should be on the LHS, or something.
fields.summary: improve UI of small chart links

fields.description:
1. the preview chart images are currently scaled client side --- scaling them down server side should make it load faster
2. the preview chart images are regenerated when they haven't changed, which would be nice to avoid.  We could either use ajaxy magic to switch the charts (probably better if its not too complex to do), or cache the images on the server.
3. Since we've now got three types of loc charts (small one on browse/changelog page, large one on chart page, small one on chart page) it would be clearer to specify which one we're talking about with an enumeration rather than a boolean flag.
fields.summary: improve performance/caching of small chart links
Using request.getPathInfo() may not be accurate when servlet is called from <jsp:include>

fields.description:
Often we need to request logs from customers who often don't know where they are located. 

Thus being able to get them to generate it via the admin console can cut down the amount of support time. 

The support zip should include the logs, config file and plugins configuration files.
fields.summary: Generate Support Zip via the Administration console

fields.description:
Go to 


https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/search/FE/?comment=&contents=&addedText=&deletedText=&filename=&author=tdavies&branch=&tag=&fromdate=&todate=&groupby=changeset&refresh=y

As you can see the first changeset is not the latest changeset. 

Currently the only way to get the latest changeset for tdavies is to switch to advanced mode and run 

{noformat}
select revisions from dir / where author = "tdavies" order by date desc group by changeset 
{noformat}

I.e. adding the order by clause. 

The simple search should include the order by and default to desc.
fields.summary: Add order by Date asc/desc to simple criteria and by default have desc checked.

fields.summary: Unable to use SSL/TLS to send mail through GMail SMTP servers

fields.description:
We also need a place to advertise/document this service. Perhaps create (or raise a subtask) "Web Resources" section to the development hubs that clear indicates this is available. That page should also outline the general url structure of FE/CRU

/api/ the original api
/browse/repname/~CONSTRAINT/path etc
/search/?whatever&csv
/cru/REVIEW_KEY
/plugins/servlet etc
/whatver-the-rest-apis are
fields.summary: document web resources for dev hub

fields.description:
Some notfications of branches can be > than 1M within out own source repositories. Customers may have large amount of watches and bigger repository which could cause problems.

applies to RSS feeds as well
fields.summary: Limit the size of watch notifications as notifications of branches can be quite large
If SVNKit cannot authenticate successfully, it goes into a tight loop retrying

fields.description:
I expected hits below my current path to be weighted higher. On reflection, maybe this isn't a good idea, but we should consider it.

re: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/quicknav+review
fields.summary: Respecting the current path for quicknav search

fields.description:
I think quicknav should display branch and tag hits rather thank just match them as a directory. Quicksearch already does this. Another reason for this would be that they won't match as directories in cvs or perforce (I'm guessing that, I haven't verified it).

re: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/quicknav+review
fields.summary: explicit branch and tag hits for quicknav

fields.description:
I'm torn about showing more results, 6 file hits is definitely way better than 3. Though ideally I think we should work on a total number of results rather fixed x per type. E.g. rather than 6 file hits and 3 or each other type. 12 results in total, with all 12 being changeset hits if there are only changeset hits.

re: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/quicknav+review
fields.summary: more/smarter quicknav results

fields.description:
There should be an obvious way to get access the list of keywords. An extra entry at the bottom of the list that pops up a gmail style tips pane would be a simple solution. Or even just pop up on typing ? with a tooltip to that effect somewhere.

re: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/quicknav+review
fields.summary: quick search syntax help

fields.description:
Partial matches don't hit in comments? The comment search that I think would be useful is JIRA ID. 

also For filename, path, branch and tag hits results that start with the search term should rank above other partial hits.

re http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/quicknav+review
fields.summary: show partial matches in quicknav results

fields.description:
Reverse Chronological Ordering
The changeset results should be massively weighted to date. The chances of 1779 being more relevant than 20805 are remote. In general I don't think that weighting shorter results higher than longer results is a good thing for concise search terms.
fields.summary: weight changeset results heavily by weight
make quicknav results width smarter

fields.description:
I think we could use a subtle spinner in the end of the box. There will always be times when it isn't fast enough and I think it is important to get that visual feedback.
!worddav3b71b169cfd10edaaef2b4ff93ccdb4f.png|height=43,width=345!To make it less jarring and more subtle, maybe the normal spinner could be made a tad lighter and/or smaller.
fields.summary: add spinner to quicknav

fields.description:
Often when I use fish eye i want to find a specific commit and the  check it out or merge it.

Hence I need to svn url.  And typing in svn urls is a pain.  

So if in FishEye I am here

https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/jira/jira/branches/atlassian_jira_3_13_branch

I would like to see link to

https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/private/atlassian/jira/branches/atlassian_jira_3_13_branch

that is easily copied and pasted.  

Also on an individual commit I would like the commit number to be easily copied and pasted.

For example maybe you can have a link that says "to merge this change use this command : svn merge -c 12345 svn/url/tag


It would be nice in fisheye if I could get the svn url to a given commit or at least to the containing branch.  

JIRA Studio does it quite nicely.
fields.summary: Have  a copy and pasteable link to the SVN path inside FishEye

fields.description: Go to profile, email, change your display name, click 'Save' -- display name hasn't changed.
fields.summary: Changing display name doesn't work

fields.description: My company currently uses Fisheye for our Subversion repository. We'd like for Fisheye to also support the Bazaar VCS.
fields.summary: Add bzr VCS support to Fisheye

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Import the attached dump into svn
2) Create a repository in fisheye to point to this SVN and include the following symbolic rules
{noformat}
<symbolic auto-rules="true"><trunk logical="${1}" name="trunk" regex="trunk/([^/]+)(/|$)"/><branch logical="${1}" name="${1}-${2}" regex="branches/([^/]+)/([^/]+)"/><tag logical="${1}" name="${1}-${2}" regex="tags/([^/]+)/([^/]+)"/></symbolic>
{noformat}
3) Kick of the index, then navigate to the repository. You will only see the tags/fpoweb directory with no subdirectory but if you change the url to go to tags/fpoweb/latest then you see the latest directory and its subdirectories.
fields.summary: A combination of incorrect symbolic rules defined and setting "Use in built symbolic rules" can cause directories to show up as missing. However if you manually type in the subdirectories, they show up as expected

fields.description:
We should document FISHEYE_INST/system.properties, and what some of the values for system props are:

eg jetty.http.headerbuffersize
org.mortbya.jetty.*
fields.summary: document system.properties

fields.description: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13917?page=com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye%3Afisheye-issuepanel doesn't show my last week's commits, and I hear Agnes has the same problem. My code was committed with the proper JIRA issue though.
fields.summary: JAC Fisheye doesn't show my commits

fields.description: 1.6.5 is going to require Perforce users who have case insensitive repositories to re-index their repos. This will not be enforced by FishEye. This needs to be prominently mentioned in the release notes.
fields.summary: Documentation about Case Insensitive Perforce users

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) Create new application fisheye in crowd
2) Add an LDAP directory and set "Allow All to Authenticate" to "False" for the "LDAP" group
3) Then add to the Groups tab one specific group in LDAP which only contains a small subset of users
4) Configure fisheye to communicate with this Crowd server
5) Select re-sync and this will add all the users in LDAP rather than just the ones that belong to the configured group. 



If you need to get rid of all the users that you have imported already via the sync, you should point fisheye to an directory within crowd that only has one user, and re-sync. This will delete all the users except for the one in the directory. Next you can go to Administration > users and delete that user and add the ones you need to, and update your crowd details to point to the correct directory. 

*If you have a small number of users that you want to add to Fisheye* my suggestion as a workaround would be to manually add the users into fisheye, and disable "auto-add" and "synchronise users with crowd". 

1) Go to Administration > Security > Crowd Authentication and set "Auto-add" to "Users must be added to Fisheye manually" and set "Synchronise users with crowd" to "No". 
2) Go to Administration > Users, and manually add the 10 users that should have access. 


*If you have a large number of users that you want to add to Fisheye* my suggestion as a workaround would be to let the users auto add into fisheye and disable "synchronise users with crowd"

1) Go to Administration > Security > Crowd Authentication and set "Auto-add" to "Create a FishEye user on successful login" and set "Synchronise users with crowd" to "No".
fields.summary: Re-Sync on crowd, will add all users in the directories rather than only the ones that belong to the configured group in the crowd application

fields.description:
We recently updated our copy of FishEye to 1.6.4 (from 1.4) and although everything appeared to be working we have now found that the FishEye tab is failing with the error 'Failed to authenticate user 'jira'. See logs for more details'.

The FishEye logs have this error, which is presumably the reason why JIRA is failing:

08-Dec-2008 09:00:35 com.sun.jersey.spi.spring.container.servlet.SpringServlet springComponentAnnotationAvailable
INFO: The spring Component annotation is present: using spring >= 2.5
ERROR - Error for /rest-service/auth-v1/login
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder
fields.summary: Errors in log when authenticating through REST (i.e. JIRA)

fields.description:
Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1397].

Sometimes it is necessary in Perforce to update the changeset in Perforce. For example to insert an issue id for an commit that fixes an issue raised in Jira.

However currently the only way to pick up these changes is to rescan your entire Perforce repository.

It would be good to add the ability to be able to rescan commit messages for Perforce, similar to SVN's rescan properties for revision range.
fields.summary: Allow Perforce repositories to rescan commit comments

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Have a LONG running watch 
# Make sure that the _FE-WatchManager thread_ is processing it
# Delete the watch
# watch for the _FE-WatchManager_ thread to finish with it
# Note that the watch is back in the profile-show watches

To remove the watch:
Make sure that the _FE-WatchManager_ thread is NOT processing the watch and delete the watch.
fields.summary: Watch reappear after it has been removed

fields.description:
While trying to crunch some metrics for our development processes, I used EyeQL to grab a bunch of change sets from FE in csv - which was cool.

What's not cool is that the dates they return are in GMT timezone - only, whilst the UI shows them on the server local timezone. Confusing. It would good to be able to at least get the return dates in the same timezone as the rest of the UI, or better still, configurable.
fields.summary: EyeQL csv return dates in customisable timezone

fields.description:
need a FE rest page similar to the CRU one
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+REST+API

NB. when publishing, ALSO ADD A LINK TO THIS PAGE:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Development+Hub
fields.summary: Add documentation for REST interface
we need REST versions of the com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.services.* services.

fields.description: The bundled help page at /api/ should have a clear section at the start that points to the FE and CRU dev hubs, and notes that this page reprensetns the "original" fisheye api, and that there are more available.
fields.summary: Add a dev hub pointer in the bundled /api/ help page

fields.description:
All the FE/CRU static content is under /static/RND/

However, if an external resource wants to reference a (say) changeset icon, then they have to tie their url to a specific build of FE/CRU.

We should 302 tmp redirect /static/current/XYZ to /static/RND/XYZ as a service to external consumers.

We should *NOT* use /static/current/ internally as that would mean all our image loads require two http requests.

We also need a place to advertise/document this service. Perhaps create (or raise a subtask) "Web Resources" section to the development hubs that clear indicates this is available. That page should also outline the general url structure of FE/CRU

/api/ the original api
/browse/repname/~CONSTRAINT/path etc
/search/?whatever&csv
/cru/REVIEW_KEY
/plugins/servlet etc
/whatver-the-rest-apis are
fields.summary: add a /static/current/ redirect to assist external consumers

fields.description:
A customer using a custom authenticator is having problems because Jetty's default max header size (4096 bytes) is too small for the SSO app he's trying to integrate. To fix this, add a system property to FE that will set the max header size on the Jetty connector:

http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/Configuring+Connectors
fields.summary: add the ability to set the max HTTP header size via a system property

fields.description:
Currently in the administration, customers can check if they are on the latest version of crucible. 

I would like a similar new feature that displays crucible/fisheye announcements/tips. I.e. crucible/fisheye polls our site to download the latest announcements/tips and displays it in the default administration page. 

This way when we do a new release we can put it on a file on one our servers and then all the customers admin pages will automatically update to display this message to their admin. 

The announcement/message should remain until the admin decides to remove it, thus ensuring that admins have viewed the important announcements. 

We could use this feature to announce important bug fixes, or known issues, which hopefully will decrease support and encourage customers to move to new releases. It can also be used to announce new features, etc.
fields.summary: View Fisheye/Crucible Announcements within Admin Page
refine performance, EAC comments
Add doco for "path != word"

fields.description: In addition to existing "path like glob"
fields.summary: Add "path = word" to eyeql

fields.description: Inefficiency in the watch manager (someone has a watch on the zip file). Any notifications in this period are queued until this check finished.
fields.summary: Improve the performance of watch manager
add smart filename search to quicksearch (including CamelCase initals)
If you specify an includes, only request the included paths, rather than requesting all paths then filtering out those that do not belong to the includes.

fields.description: When a HTML watch email for a changeset comes in with a binary file listed, the "diffs" link is rendered. Why should binary files be able to be diff'ed? The link should be hidden for binary files. Narrowed it down to, *FISHEYE_HOME/template/changeset-mail-html.ftl*. The check should probably also include a binary check ([#if rev.binary]): {code}... [#elseif rev.ancestorRevision?exists] diffs [/#if] ... {code} produces an email that looks like: {code} ________________________________________ - added user link ________________________________________ ~Project/docs/MyFile.xls1.64 binary raw diffs show watches {code}
fields.summary: Diffs link shows up in HTML changeset emails for binary files

fields.description:
Currently FishEye shows only revision numbers and the committer (for whole sections of the file) in annotated file view. To see even the commit message you have to click on revision hyperlink, which moves you to a different page and after reading it you have to manually go back.
One of prospective FishEye customers suggested that FishEye should optimally show related JIRA issue for annotated code on the left hand side or at least commit message or JIRA key in the tooltip (mouse hover).
I think it's really good idea.
fields.summary: Show related JIRA issues in annotated file view

fields.description: Currently, Fisheye doesn't support multiple charsets. So if users' commit messages are *EUC-KR* charset , and their files are *UTF-8* charset, then one or the other will probably be wrong. We should perhaps have more fine-grained charset detection.
fields.summary: Support multiple charsets

fields.description: which means on startup, there will be no symbolic rules. but when viewing the repo in admin, it says that auto-rules=true.
fields.summary: if the symbolic tag is missing, on save repo, one will be created with auto-rules set to true

fields.description:
For a perforce repository View a changeset in fisheye. 

Certain files will show up as no "No Change" despite the fact that there is a reported number of lines added/removed. 
If you click through to the diff, you can see the diff (with the correct number of lines added/removed)

Looking at the log files in order to determine the diff in the changeset view fisheye does this:

{noformat}
/usr/local/bin/p4 -p perforce.host.com:1666 -u USER print -q //depot/main/some/path/to/file.txt@13366 
/usr/local/bin/p4 -p perforce.host.com:1666 -u USER print -q //depot/some/other/path/to/file.txt@13365
{noformat}

and diffs these. 

However if you go through to the diff it basically does a diff of the path "//depot/main/some/path/to/file.txt" with the previous version of the same path. 

The diffs should be done consistently rather than differently.
fields.summary: When viewing a changeset, perforce reports that there has been number of lines added/removed but "No Change" is report under the file rather than the diff.
Improve handling of Perforce encoding - especially Shift-JIS
rereview/refine quicknav

fields.description: a URl should match closing parens only if a preceding open paren has been seen. This will mean that links in brackets (http://likethis.com) don't get borked
fields.summary: url.def should be smarter about parentheses in URLs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) Add file in perforce in Shift-JIS (932) encoding (like attached zip) and submit file
2) Create perforce repo in fisheye, set the charset as Shift-JIS 932
3) Let the file be indexed
4) View file and the characters show up garbled.
fields.summary: Files saved in another encoding beside UTF-8 (example shift-JIS) does not render properly in fisheye for perforce repositories.

fields.description:
From the Browse screen, there is a Sub Directories box.  In this box, the sub directories appear all lowercase.  Clicking on them works, since Perforce on Windows is case insensitive.  But many of our directories consist of multiple words (CamelCase style) and showing them as lowercase makes it hard to read.  We want them to appear in the case they are set in Perforce.

They show up in most places in FishEye and Crucible with the right case, this isn't a global problem, but only specific areas.

Attached are screenshots showing the problem.  In both cases the directory name should be "UnicodeSurrogates".
fields.summary: Case of Sub Directories box doesn't match depot

fields.description:
Reported by customer from [FSH-1332|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1332].

{quote}
This appears to be an issue that is unique to Perforce, see:

    * http://kb.perforce.com/P4dServerReference/CrlfIssuesAn..LineEndings

In Perforce if a user chooses the wrong LineEnd for the client, it can result in a mix of Unix and Windows line ends in the file.

The Crucible application, on seeing the double line endings is croaking with this error.
{quote}

The workaround is to fix this issue on this file using a dos2unix command line script. However this can be tedious. 

It would be preferred if fisheye could error out with the file name that has the bad line endings and perhaps with a line number rather than the line itself  (Reasoning: Code security means that Software Code should not be appearing in a log file... the log file could be insecure if an end user does not secure it properly.)
fields.summary: p4 Issue to do with line endings causes logs to fill up with unexpected line errors

Error customer is getting:

{noformat}
2008-11-10 17:12:35,921 ERROR [pool-4-thread-1] fisheye.app RepositoryScanner-startRepo - Unable to initialise repository https://path/to/svn/server/ [^] due to java.lang.NullPointerException:null
java.lang.NullPointerException

    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.util.jna.SVNWinSecurity.getAuthHeader(SVNWinSecurity.java:68)

    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVRepository.openConnection(DAVRepository.java:976)
    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVRepository.getLatestRevision(DAVRepository.java:177)
    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.wc.SVNBasicClient.getRevisionNumber(SVNBasicClient.java:479)

    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.info2(SVNClientImpl.java:2203)
    at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.info2(SVNClientImpl.java:2162)
    at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.info2(SVNClient.java:347)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.info2(SvnThrottledClient.java:111)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryTester.getServerRootURL(SvnRepositoryTester.java:91)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryTester.checkRepoSettings(SvnRepositoryTester.java:72)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.checkRepoSettings(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:341)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.validateRepo(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:260)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.startRepo(RepositoryScanner.java:316)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:242)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.ping(RepositoryScanner.java:210)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(SvnRepositoryEngine.java:80)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.OneOffPingRequest.doRequest(OneOffPingRequest.java:30)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.process(PingRequest.java:68)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processPingRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:120)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.queuePingRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:110)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.run(PingRequest.java:35)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) 
{noformat}

Raised issue with svnkit who have provided the following solution. 
{quote}
Hello,

Thank you for reporting this issue. We've fixed similar NPE recently and I think it could be already resolved in the latest version of SVNKit in 1.2.x branch.

What version of SVNKit do you use? You may download latest 1.2.x binary from our build server (direct link: https://teamcity.svnkit.com/repository/download/bt14/4147:id/deploy/org.tmatesoft.svn_1.2.0.5153.standalone.zip [^] ).

Also, you may try to change order in which HTTP authentication schemes are tried by SVNKit by setting the following system property:

svnkit.http.methods=Basic,Digetst,Negotiate,NTLM

So that SVNKit will only fall back to NTLM when no other scheme is available (usually mod_sspi in apache is set up in such away that it provides both Basic and NTLM schemes).
{quote}
fields.summary: Need to update svnkit that resolves an NPE to do with NTLM authentication.

fields.description:
I'm on a gigabit connection to the Perforce server, have plenty of RAM, multiple CPU's and only one CPU is being utilised. gah!

What I would like is to set in the Admin console the 'maximum concurrent index threads per repository', the current option to set '3' is fine if you have 3 repositories.  I don't.  This feature would potentially reduce the index time by a factor of how many CPU's I have (say 4).  This feels like a relatively simple change (farm out a changeset index to another thread, update UI with status).

This would be a major performance improvement for installations with large repositories.
fields.summary: Indexing doesnt make use of multiple CPU's

fields.description: Just tailing a logfile, and Ive just seen my terminal dissolve due to control codes in the log.  Im imagining there is a binary file in the Perforce repository that is being indexed, it would be could to do an isAscii check on the data and not print out garbage!  The result of this problem is that I cant actually check the error log for real problems, which is a little frustrating as Im just getting FE setup on a large repo and may be having problems - but I can't tell!
fields.summary: Error log contains 'Unexpected line' entries that corrupt console

fields.description:
If a customer p4 annotate command e.g. {noformat} p4 annotate -c -q //depot/path/to/file {noformat} Returns something like below: {noformat} ... 61508: set line of code 62709: line of code
HTML: .... {noformat} Then we will get the following error: {noformat} 2008-11-17 14:33:30,401 ERROR [btpool0-17] fisheye.app P4Cache-getBlame - Exception getting annotation for file@62709 com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4ClientException: java.lang.NumberFormatException:For input string: "
HTML" at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4Client.getBlame(P4Client.java:396) at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.P4Cache.getBlame(P4Cache.java:282) at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.RepositorySource.getBlame(RepositorySource.java:289) at com.cenqua.crucible.view.AnnotateDO.(AnnotateDO.java:43) at com.cenqua.crucible.tags.AnnotatorTag.doStartTag(AnnotatorTag.java:34) at org.apache.jsp.tag.web.review.frxInner_tag.doTag(frxInner_tag.java:281) at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.crucible.review.monolithic.displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp._jspx_meth_rev_frxInner_0(displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp.java:195) at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.crucible.review.monolithic.displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp._jspx_meth_cru_asJavascriptString_1(displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp.java:162) at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.crucible.review.monolithic.displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp._jspService(displayFrxInnerDiv_jsp.java:78) at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:93) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820) at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:487) {noformat} As fisheye is expecting everyline to start with : where changelist is a number. From case [CRC-367]
fields.summary: Reading p4 annotate fails with "NumberFormatException" when customers annotate ouput does not being with <changeset>:

fields.description:
The decorator page layouts for some of the documentation spaces are customised, to show the left-hand pagetree navigation panel.

Because of the custom decorator, the new Confluence 2.10 decorator is not applied. This causes GUI problems — in particular with this upgrade to 2.10, the new Quick Nav function does not work at all in the affected spaces.

Fix: Apply the Default Page Layout, then re-insert the custom code. See instructions:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Fixing+pagetree+nav+on+CAC+Confluence+upgrade

Apply the fix to the spaces on CAC as listed below.

    * All FISHEYE and FISHEYExx spaces
    * All CRUCIBLE and CRUCIBLExx spaces
    * All CLOVER and CLOVERxx spaces
fields.summary: Upgrade the decorator page layouts in all doc spaces that use left-hand nav

fields.description:
As you can see in the attachment, the red text indicates the the Perforce repo was stopped, but the main list still indicates its stopping.  Even if it _is_ stopped, refreshing the view doesn't update this information.

If the status of a repo is changed, the admin/view repos view should accurately reflect such state.
fields.summary: Stopped Perforce repo shows conflicting repository status information when stopped

fields.description: When using the advanced search editor, the full text search on the repository content is currently restricted to whole word matches only. It would be useful to extend this to allow regex searches as well. Regex searches are already enabled on comments.
fields.summary: Enable EyeQL to perform regex searches on the full content

fields.description:
For a customer with a large SVN repository, indexing the repository can make the {{/var/cache/REPO/revcache/data.bin}} file exceed 2G. 

We should spilt the index up, so a single file will never exceed 2G.
fields.summary: Divide cache files so they do not exceed 2G file size

fields.description: Make similar improvements to {{FisheyeRepositoryExplorer}} with regards to WaybackSpecs as were implemented for FE-799.
fields.summary: Improve history traversal for FisheyeRepositoryExplorer when traversing revision histories with Wayback Specs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce. 

1) Install fisheye as a [windows service|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91554194] and do not set a fisheye.inst directory
2) Delete all log files so you get a fresh set of log files
2) Start fisheye as a service. 

The wrapper.log file will be created but the debug files will not, thus turning debug on via the console will not result in any new log mesages. 

To get your logs you will need to set your fisheye.inst variable. 

To set this refer to [Can Fisheye be run as a service|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91554194]. You need to add something like:

{noformat}
wrapper.java.additional.11=-Dfisheye.inst="c:\FISHEYE_Data"
{noformat}

To your wrapper.conf. 

Next you need to move you configuration to this location, i.e. 

copy C:\Crucible\config.xml and C:\Crucible\var directory to your c:\FISHEYE_Data directory. 

Next restart crucible and check your Administration > Sys Info/Support > System Info, to ensure its picking up the correct location for your FISHYE_INST, i.e. you should see:

{noformat}
FISHEYE_INST: c:\FISHEYE_Data
{noformat}

Your logs will now be located at c:\FISHEYE_Data\var\log directory.
fields.summary: When fisheye is started as a windows service, the fisheye-*.log.* files are not created when no fisheye.inst directory is set

fields.description: Only text written to the PrintStream via println is copied to the log
fields.summary: Mail log doesn't show SMTP transcript in debug mode

fields.description:
See

http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/browse/public/contrib/confluence/confluence-attachments-plugin/trunk/src/main/resources/templates/extra/attachments/attachmentsmacro.vm?r1=23772&r2=25560
vs
http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/changelog/public?cs=25560
fields.summary: Inconsistent diffs (changeset screen shows 1 line changed, diff screen shows more)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce, 

1) Set up a linker as below:

{noformat}
<linker>
<simple description="Link to JIRA" href="https://jira.atlassian.com/jira/browse/${0}" regex="[a-zA-Z]{2,}-\d+ "/>
</linker>
{noformat}

(notice the space at the end of the regex)

2) Make a commit with commit message with "Fix to JIRA-52"

3) Navigate to fisheye and view the changeset, the Link to JIRA-52



We should remove any trailing whitespaces from the regex expression. If they are circumstances where a trailing whitespace is desirable, then we should at least provide a warning message that they have a trailing whitespace on their regex.
fields.summary: Spaces can be added to the end of linkers regex, which can cause the linkers to appear to fail

fields.description:
Not sure if this should be a bug or support.

Over the past few days I've noticed that FE seems to be missing a few revisions.

Specifically 

|| Bamboo build || FE Link ||
| http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/browse/BAM-MAIN-4122 | https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo?cs=70218 |
| http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/browse/BAM-MAIN-4105 | https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo?cs=69917 |

There may be more, but these are the only two I noticed.
fields.summary: FishEye appears to be missing revisions

fields.description:
If a user sets up a symbolic link to their FISHEYE_HOME eg. they have installed in /home/crucible-1.6.3 but linked to it via /home/crucible and they have not set a FISHEYE_INST 

Then they will get the following:

{noformat}
2008-11-13 11:45:25,808 ERROR [main] org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader-initWebApplicationContext - Context initialization failed
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/applicationContext.xml]; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalStateException: Annotation-specified bean name 'hostComponentProvider' for bean class [com.atlassian.plugin.spring.SpringHostComponentProvider] conflicts with existing, non-compatible bean definition of same name and class [com.atlassian.plugin.spring.SpringHostComponentProvider]
{noformat}

Because their lib jar files are loaded twice. 

This is because fisheye thinks that the FISHEYE_HOME and the FISHEYE_INST are different directories (due to the symbolic link) when they are not. 

Setting priority as blocker as it this fix should be simple and it leads to many critical cases (i.e. my server won't start up)
fields.summary: If a user starts there application after naviagting to their FISHEYE_HOME directory via a symbolic link and have no FISHEYE_INST setup, they will not be able to start their application.

fields.description:
FishEye has a built-in service to generate a patch file for any two changesets or any two revisions of a single file. It is available as a barebones web page that, when called without parameters, produces man-page like instructions. This service is currently not documented on CAC.

Instructions:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/rdiff/FE

Used to generate a patch file for a diff between 2 revisions of a single file:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/rdiff/FE/trunk/src/java/com/atlassian/crucible/spi/rpc/EscapingXMLStreamWriter.java?r1=21372&r2=21445
fields.summary: Document the "RDiff" feature

fields.description:
FishEye has no button or icon to create a patch file when the user views a diff of two file revisions. The only way to create a patch file is to manually invoke:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/rdiff/FE/path/to/file?r1=21372&r2=21445

It'd be nice to have an explicit icon that says "generate patch for this diff" that would bring up a "save as" dialog to store the text file on disk.
fields.summary: Add "Patch" icon to diff pages

fields.description:
Customers can change the description of their repository in fisheye and it will ask them if they want to re-index or continue. 

It should not ask customers to re-index if they have changed a value that will not affect the repository. 

Generated from [FSH-1198|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1198].
fields.summary: Changing parameters that do not require an re-index should not ask the user to re-index

fields.description:
If you have to authors with identical names save for capitalisation, one called 'Matt' and one called 'matt', revisions from both of them will appear in the file box when there is no author constraint provided.

However, the 'Author' dropdown will only have an entry for 'matt' (lowercase), and specifying this constraint will not include revisions associated with 'Matt' in the output. 

Similarly, if you hack the URL to specify a wayback spec for 'Matt' - the results will not include revisions associated with 'matt'.

We need to either make it fully case sensitive (and have a constraint for both 'matt' and 'Matt' available) or fully case insensitive (and show results for 'Matt' when the 'matt' author constraint is specified.

Setting to minor as this won't really crop up in real-life situations much.
fields.summary: File Explorer author constraint is case-sensitive

fields.description:
I just noticed that when setting up repositories, they were created with 'default' which mean if public sign up was on, they were able to see the repos.  For the sake of security, a fresh install should default to restricting access to admins, perhaps through a default-created group 'admins'.  Anon access should also default to the safe NO option.

Given that access to a repo enables complete tarball dumps, security must take precedence over any initial ease of use...
fields.summary: Repository Security improvement - the default for creating a new repository should be restricted to admins until specifically configured.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

I'd like to have one e-mail account for 2 records but when I try to modify it as admin I've get the following error:
{noformat}
Email address must be unique, currently used by <ANOTHER ACCOUNT>
{noformat}

Incidental if you press cancel, then you get a NullPointerException (we should fix this). 

However if the user itself goes and updates email address using Profile this error does not appear and the e-mail is successfully duplicated. 

The customer (in FSH-1299) would like to allow duplicate email addresses and asks that the restriction on admins should be removed (esp since the users themselves can do it).
fields.summary: Administrator cannot set a users email to be the same as another user, but the user itself can.
